definition: to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means

pinyin: Jian3 shi4 fang2 wu4 zhou1 kan1

sentences.english: Pakistan has always been the ready testing ground for defence-related technologies from China.
sentences.chinese: 巴基斯坦向来是中国防务相关技术的试验场。

sentences.english: Jane's may be located in the defense of professional journals, bothered to explain these issues.
sentences.chinese: 可能简氏定位于专业防务期刊，不屑于解释这些问题。
防务研究与开发局拒绝置评。

sentences.english: The huge 7th Fleet of the US Navy has the Pacific in its area of responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 美国庞大的第七舰队负责太平洋区防务。

sentences.english: The root of the problem isn't a lack of U.S. spending.
sentences.chinese: 其实问题的根源并非美国防务开支不足。

sentences.english: Such defense assistance might well be increased in direct response to the reduction in U.
sentences.chinese: 这些防务援助可能是对美国削减军事援助的直接回应。

sentences.english: Defense companies submitted their proposals for the first phase of GCV in late May.
sentences.chinese: 防务公司在5月下旬提交了GCV第一阶段的的建议。

sentences.english: Clinton clarified the U.S. position on European security and defense.
sentences.chinese: 克林顿澄清了美国在欧洲安全与防务问题上的立场。

sentences.english: NATO’s work on cyber defence will be integrated into NATO’s Defence Planning Process.
sentences.chinese: 北约赛博防御工作将被纳入北约防务计划流程。

sentences.english: The Ministry of Defence said the soldiers were from 1st Battalion The Royal Anglian Regiment.
sentences.chinese: 防务部门说这几个士兵来自皇家英国军队一营。

sentences.english: Funding is only part of the defense equation, of course.
sentences.chinese: 当然，经费问题只是防务平衡的一部分。

definition: military aircraft/secret plan/Privy Council during the Qing dynasty
